result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Monroe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appears in person pro se.  ADA Denis Stingl appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on defendant's petition for return of property.  State opposes return of property.  Court hears argument.  For reaons as stated on the record, Court GRANTS petition and orders pistol and magazine returned to defendant. 

Filed, signed Order
MPD Inventory #15006610(HENRY MOORE).
Return of property hearing at 12-11-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to sentencing. Court orders 60 day sentence in the House of Corrections with credit for 4 days time served. 
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 9 months with the following conditions:  
*no new offenses
*no drug use
*complete gun safety course with proof of attendance
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be paid during the term of probation and, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges during the term of probation and, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in trial and unable to hold sentencing hearing today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.63(1)(a) a Misd.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for further negotiations.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 04-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Steven Van Erden.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/16/15.
HMP
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Henry Monroe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  
Defendant Henry Monroe in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
